title: Digital Technology and Cognitive Processes: Educational Design from a Situated Cognition Perspective

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Students primarily use smartphones for digital technology, requiring critical thinking about technology's cognitive impact within social contexts

learning_goals: Explain core assumptions of situational cognitive theory and analyze the impact of digital technologies on cognitive processes
Evaluate the positive/negative effects of digital tools on attention, memory, and thinking processes through case studies
Propose instructional design strategies for cognitive enhancement when integrating technology in educational settings

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
